AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.ten undocumented aliens: undocumented immigrants discovered at the immigration checkpoint stop, hidden in the tractor-trailer's sleeper area, testified against Ramon De La Cruz and were transported by Raymond McMillon
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: alleged co-conspirator of Ramon De La Cruz, also requesting continuances, rode with Ramon De La Cruz in the tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz: defendant arguing about the thirty-day exclusion period and its impact on the Speedy Trial Act violation, wore a blinking cellular Bluetooth Device and white clothing during the incident, had aliens hidden in his tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant who challenges the search of the tractor-trailer and argues about the Speedy Trial Act, transported aliens including Jorge Miguel Hernandez-Gomez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena: United States Border Patrol Agent involved in the immigration checkpoint stop, testified at Ramon De La Cruz's trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Manuel Hernandez: United States Border Patrol Agent who prepared to have his canine, Aroxa, perform a sniff of the tractor-trailer's exterior steps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Aroxa: canine used by Manuel Hernandez for inspection at the immigration checkpoint stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Miguel Hernandez-Gomez: individual who arranged to pay for smuggling, testified at Ramon De La Cruz's trial, was an alien transported by Raymond McMillon
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that received canine records for in camera inspection and made docket orders regarding the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: governs the timing of trials, including exclusions for certain periods, with requirements for ends-of-justice findings
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Eric Camacho: United States Border Patrol Agent testifying about smuggling practices and financial transactions involving smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cellular Bluetooth Device: evidence item used to identify Ramon De La Cruz at trial, with conflicting testimony about its possession
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.contraband: alerted by Aroxa in the tractor-trailer's rear sleeper area, during immigration checkpoint stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Presentence Investigation Report: calculated a Guidelines-sentencing range of 41 to 51 months' imprisonment for Ramon De La Cruz
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.motion to dismiss the indictment: motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz and Raymond McMillon, denied by the United States District Court
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.immigration checkpoint stop: location where Ramon De La Cruz and others were stopped by United States Border Patrol Agents, with questions asked to determine citizenship status
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.search of the tractor-trailer: ensued after the immigration checkpoint stop, was challenged by Ramon De La Cruz as impermissible, subject of Ramon De La Cruz's motions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: recognized the constitutionality of suspicionless routine vehicle stops at immigration checkpoints for determining citizenship
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena and Manuel Hernandez: United States Border Patrol Agents involved in the immigration checkpoint stop, testified at Ramon De La Cruz's trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's indictment: indictment against Ramon De La Cruz for alien transportation offenses, including conspiracy to transport aliens within the United States for commercial advantage or private financial gain
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's trial: trial of Ramon De La Cruz for smuggling undocumented aliens, began after denial of motion to dismiss
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's appeal: appeal by Ramon De La Cruz of his sentence and conviction for smuggling undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz and Zeba Williams: defendants whose requests for continuances were granted by the United States District Court
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.thirty-day exclusion period: exclusion period under the Speedy Trial Act that began to run after December 17 submissions and ended on January 5
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's argument: argument regarding the thirty-day exclusion period and its impact on the Speedy Trial Act violation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court's denial of: denial of Ramon De La Cruz's motion to dismiss, based on the calculation of non-excludable days under the Speedy Trial Act
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress: motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz to suppress evidence seized from the immigration checkpoint stop, challenged the lawfulness of the stop and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court's ruling on: ruling made by the United States District Court on Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress, on January 5
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's motion to dismiss the: motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz on January 12, which tolled the Speedy Trial Act case clock
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's convictions: convictions of Ramon De La Cruz for smuggling undocumented aliens, being challenged on sufficiency of evidence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's motion to dismiss: pretrial motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz, denied by the United States District Court
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams' consent: consent given by Zeba Williams to United States Border Patrol Agent before the search of the tractor-trailer, with testimony that he knew he could refuse to do so if he wished
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.suppression hearing: hearing considered 'under advisement' after December 17 submissions, with a thirty-day exclusion period starting to run
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court's denial of: ruling made by the United States District Court on Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress, on January 5
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pretrial motion: motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz before trial, subject to exclusions under the Speedy Trial Act
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.hearing on the motion: proceeding where evidence is presented regarding the pretrial motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.post-hearing briefs: submissions made after the hearing on the motion, necessary for the court's disposition, filed by the parties after the suppression hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.papers necessary to dispose of the motio: documents required for the court to rule on the pretrial motion, gathered by the United States District Court to adjudicate the suppression motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.statutory exclusions: periods excluded from the Speedy Trial Act's time calculations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act clock: mechanism for tracking time under the Speedy Trial Act, including start and stop times
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's Speedy Trial Act case: mechanism for tracking time under the Speedy Trial Act, including start and stop times, tolled during the period of motions and hearings
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court's denial of: denial of a mitigating role adjustment at sentencing by the United States District Court
